Reviews.Title: “Nice economy stay!”
Reviews.Author: FelineFan
Reviews.Content: I used the Extended Stay suites for an overnight stay, not an extended one, but I thought it would work for its intended purpose very well. The room was well-designed, with thought given to everything from the bath to the kitchen and the bedroom area. The bed was very firm but easy to sleep on. A full-size fridge was a bonus for an overnight guest like myself. Noise off I-35E was not a factor inside the room. The A/C worked fine for early March; for mid-August, I think it might struggle, but I can't say that for sure. Definitely a bargain for my $30 bid via Priceline! The area doesn't have much to offer -- no restaurants or real shopping around, unless you go behind it a bit to Dallas' Design District for home decor and furnishings. As far as safety goes, I had no problems and saw nothing to raise any concerns. The room does have a full-size fridge, as well as a stove and a microwave. I'm not sure where the nearest grocery is, but you could certainly "eat in" and save some money. And like I said, I got the room for a $30 bid for a Friday night stay. Only real "con": Its exit off Commonwealth can be difficult to reach if you're coming down I-35E because of merging traffic right before that interchange -- you're in the right lane, then you're two lanes away all of a sudden. You might exit Inwood and promptly get lost!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffner115
Reviews.Content: Here for 2 months. Friendly staff. Some cleaning staff issues, only cleaned every othet week, when payed for weekly. Biggest issue, be sure to watch your clothes wash and dry. I left to grab something out of my room, 2 doors down to 2 weeks worth of clothing stolen. Not impressed with how staff handled it, nothing came of it. Therefore, out $300+. Had to buy other kitchen things, as it was not provided will not recommend this at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff great location”
Reviews.Author: 703trever
Reviews.Content: For the price and location this place is great they treat you like its is home. The rooms are clean and nice size. This is not a fancy hotel if that is what you are looking for its just a nice clean place to stay the night at a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Like home”
Reviews.Author: creoleplay
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay. Excellent features with full size kitchen, study desk, good lightinng, laundry and gym facilities. Staff were excellent. Very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: 982Traveler0005
Reviews.Content: I was going there for a convention and Hotel Anatole was sold out. The closest available hotel was Extended Stay. Booked it because ratings show 3.5 stars. Well, this is false. This hotel does not deserve more than 1 star. It has roaches, and I killed two or three of them. The carpet was extremely dirty with burnt mark and foul smell. The bed was not comfortable. It is definitely not a deluxe hotel. This is not a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: mortac8
Reviews.Content: nice place. friendly staff. i stayed in a deluxe room for about 2 months and it was comfortable and pretty cheap too. the only bad thing is that it's not in the best location as there's not really a grocery store or decent restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not so clean!”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler08208
Reviews.Content: The sofa on the couch had 7 different color stains (do not want to know what originated) so let's just say I never sat on the couch nor did I want to put my luggage on it. The sheets did not seem like they were washed but thankfully I brought my pillow case with me. The bathtub had mold growing and coffee table still had coffee stains on it. Bottom line - avoid this place if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Family”
Reviews.Author: phxplayboi
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling for some time now, and I always find myself excited when I am going back to this hotel. Truely the manager Robert, and Verna from the front desk, they really do know what it means to make you feel right at home. Verna has a great dispositoin and Robert will help you with any problems you may have even if they are personal. The rooms are always in such great order, and they really do take pride in the appearance and maintence of the property. I have to say this is the best run hotel I have stayed in. I would give this place at least a three star rating myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, with friendly and helpful employees.”
Reviews.Author: mamma_v_luvsu
Reviews.Content: We particularly enjoy the kitchen, Internet connection, sleeper sofa (living room kind of area), and table & chairs to play games or get work done, if necessary ... especially when traveling with the kids. If you are goig to stay for several days, you can save $$ cooking a few meals "at home" and holding snacks, sodas, etc. in the fridge. In the deluxe--with two double beds and a sleeper sofa, my husband and I, two sons, and nephew can stay fairly comfortably and reasonably. Downside: No free breakfast or maid service on the weekends. As long as you know that ahead of time and don't expect it, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent PQR & location”
Reviews.Author: jpc36
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcome. Clean, spacious, and convenient room (studio). It's nice to have a kitchen. One needs to provide for one's own breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Never been happier with a hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LindseyMike
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our hotel and room, the service is amazing and they are always willing to do anything they can to assist you in any needs. The rooms if you can call them rooms, "which are actually like apartments." I would recommend this hotel to any one coming to Dallas, for any reason. the rooms are great for one weekend or several months, it's just like being at home! Great for one person or the whole family, they have the room to accommodate your needs!

Reviews.Title: “There's plenty of better options”
Reviews.Author: zikh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for quite some time while on a summer job. I was not at all familiar with the Dallas area and just wanted to find an affordable place close By the time I realized that it wasnâ€™t the greatest place to be, I had already committed to the monthly rate, and was going to end up paying a whole lot more if I moved out. Make sure you know what you are getting into before you sign up to stay here for a long a period of time. The neighborhood is BAD, period. There are a couple of office buildings and warehouses around, but otherwise itâ€™s mostly your friendly neighborhood liquor and adult stores all around. The parking lot is poorly lit and feels very unsafe at night. After my first week, my car got broken into and I lost my stereo and some other stuff. One of the staff persons said that it happens on a fairly regular basis. The reason I picked the hotel was for convenience because it was close to downtown, and it was convenient to get to work for the most part. However, if you are trying to get out during the peak hour, traffic coming into the medical center blocks out the feeder and makes it a hassle to get out. The closest grocery/shopping without having to worry about safety is a good five miles away. I used to drive over to the other side of downtown in the lemmon/knox-henderson area to do all my shopping. Itâ€™s not too bad once you get used to it. There are plenty of good restaurants in the uptown area and thatâ€™s not too far either. About the hotel itself, itâ€™s average at best. Itâ€™s supposed to be renovated, but all the kitchen appliances are falling apart and the air conditioning is fairly old/loud. But the shower was good and the bed was comfortable and thatâ€™s what I cared about most. The room was pretty spacious as well. The do have a DVD player that barely works, and cable TV sucks â€“ very few channels and no comedy central or HBO. Instead you get Showtime which plays the same two shows/movies every night. As for internet access, donâ€™t forget to pack that old modem because the wireless internet ($5/stay) is much slower than dialup. Several calls to the â€˜tech helpâ€™ turned out to be frustrating and futile. There is a laser printer in the lobby, but itâ€™s a real pain to use. Among other useful stuff, local/toll-free calls are free. There is a weird odor in the corridors but it didnâ€™t bother me that much. There is a laundry room on the first floor and a small gym (mostly cardio stuff, no weights). The front desk sells detergent and provides change as well. There is a vending machine that has some basic stuff, coffee, snacks, etc. There is a small pool, not in great shape. There is also a small conference room that you can use if you need. I must say the staff is very friendly and helpful, although for the most part there is not much they can do. There is free breakfast on weekdays, but itâ€™s nothing great â€“ just plain bagels and some fruit. Housekeeping is once a week if you stay for more than a week, but I think that is pretty typical of extended stays. You can have it cleaned on other days for ten bucks or swap out towels at the front desk for no charge. I had a couple of packages shipped over, and the front desk will accept/hold it for you. Overall, not a bad place if you staying for a couple of nights and are not overly worried about safety, but I wouldnâ€™t want to stay at this place for too long. If you have to work in downtown, consider also places on 75N, near the Northwest freeway, itâ€™s not too far and I think is a much nicer neighborhood with a lot more stuff to do around.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: mshplover
Reviews.Content: Visited Dallas over New Years and was able to get a room for $30 a night. The hotel was very good for the price. The location is right off the Highway and you have to access it by using a service road which could be a pain at times but overall wasn't bad. There really isn't places walking distance to go, but a short drive if you have a car. The rooms were large and comfortable, only had a problem with the shower draining but nothing major. If you plan on using a taxi you may have issues, it took about 45 minutes to get a taxi so be prepared for a headache but that has nothing to do with the hotel itself. Overall this a good hotel for the price. It was my first visit to Dallas and would likely stay here again If I return.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best area of town!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks clean enough on the inside, although our room did smell like smoke. There is a workout room and a coin laundry room. The hotel is the nicest one in the immediate area, but the part of town overall is not great. My husband's truck was broken into during the night while it was parked in the back of the hotel, and his car stereo was stolen. Everything else was left in the truck. Spots in front of the hotel fill up at around 7:00 p.m. There is a security guard outside at night, but he is older and uses a walker, so I am not sure how much help he could have been even if he had seen someone breaking into the truck.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay Deluxe Dallas - Market Center
HotelInfo.Address: 2979 North Stemmons Fwy (I-35E), Dallas, TX 75247
